PIVOTAL FIELD OPERATIONS A Message from Greg Stroud DECEMBER 2014 SALES NEWS FLASH Global Field Operations Team,
Please take the time to read our final communication for the year carefully; as there are a number of updates that you should be aware of.
Product Update
VRP: As part of the recent changes within Pivotal, we are adjusting and re-allocating engineering resource across the BDS product and engineering teams. One of those decisions is that effective immediately we will no longer be providing VRP to customers. Customers currently using VRP cannot expand the use of VRP in their environments. All evaluations and POCs must be pulled immediately. SKUs for VRP have been removed from the price list and will be removed shortly from the configurator. References to VRP will be removed from web and collateral associated shortly.
Pivotal services teams will be able to continue to leverage the VRP tool in combination with health-check services. However, the product must be installed and operated by Pivotal services personnel only and uninstalled at the completion of the services engagement. We will not take any support calls for the product from Pivotal resources for these health-check engagements.
The VRP end of sales was also covered during this field call from last <https://emccorp.webex.com/emccorp/ldr.php?RCID=e4cc2c587441f9c0bfd10f8b24ea2af5> week.
SFDC What's New
Deal Desk Approvals is now in SFDC! This new submission process will accelerate the approval process, give you increased visibility and is the only piece of the process that is changing. Discount thresholds and non-approval requirements will remain unchanged. More information may be found on the Global Field Operations Inside Pivotal page, FAQ for Deal Desk Approvals in SFDC.
New Customer Assets & Reference Updates
Click on "Find Reference Content" from your opportunity screen to access content. New materials include:
- Corelogic Video for use in your sales presentations - Corelogic Case Study: Leveraging Enterprise Grade Platform for Development and Data Management to Provide Corelogic Clients with New Products for Valuable Insights and Better Decisions - Indian Railways Gemfire Case Study: Distributed In-Memory Data Management Solution Improves the Capacity and Availability of New E-Ticketing System - Indian Railways Blog Post: Case Study: 300% Increase in App Performance with India Rail on Pivotal GemFire - Axel Springer Case Study: Europe’s Largest Publisher Transforms with Cloud Foundry: Axel Springer
Finally, we are also continuing to award 2 for 1 activity points for reference activities completed between now and SKO 2015. See here <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/customer-marketing-and-programs/references/2014-activity-point-values> for details.
Q1 2015 New Hire
New Hire will take place January 12-16(19-23 for FE Immersion) and all attendees must complete mandatory eLearning coursework by January 6th. By this point, all New Hires should have submitted a New Hire Registration Request Form <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/forms/d/1tf-5fImPKJYZ7eizQBjhHyWHl58JNSqfsYOfCSqPh3A/viewform>. New Hires that joined Pivotal after 12/12 will be added to the waitlist for Q2 New Hire, April 13-17 (20-24 for FE Immersion). Questions? Please contact abenoit@pivotal.io <mailto:abenoit@pivotal.io>.
WWSKO
If you have not done so already, please register for Pivotal’s WWSKO 2015 taking place February 17-20 at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square. Your lodging at the Hilton will be confirmed by registered for the event. By this point, all flights should be ticketed and submitted for expense as well. Questions? Please contact PivotalEvents@streamlinevents.com <mailto:PivotalEvents@streamlinevents.com>. P: 510-463-6084 <tel:510-463-6084> Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm, PT
Make it happen!
Greg
